DataElement.preferredName: Person Prior Antibody Therapy Require Additional Immunosuppressive Therapy For Adverse Event Management Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable response regarding whether the patient has received prior antibody therapy requiring additional immunosuppression for the management of an adverse event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prior Antibody Therapy Require Additional Immunosuppressive Therapy For Adverse Event Management Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Earlier in time or order._Treatment with injections of antibodies made in another animal or in the laboratory._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._Added; extra; further._deliberate suppression of immune system function for experimental or therapeutic purposes._The reason of something._Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Prior Antibody Therapy Requirement Additional Immunosuppressive Therapy For Adverse Event Management Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Treatment with injections of antibodies made in another animal or in the laboratory.:Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.:Added; extra; further.:deliberate suppression of immune system function for experimental or therapeutic purposes.:The reason of something.:Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Treatment with injections of antibodies to directly destroy specific, usually cancerous, cells or to stimulate the immune system to destroy those cells.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
deliberate suppression of immune system function for experimental or therapeutic purposes.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is in Cohort 1 (NS
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in Cohort 1 (NSCLC cohort) and has received prior anti-PD-1 or anti-PDL1 antibodies, did patient require the use of additional immunosuppression other than corticosteroids for the management of an AE, not have experienced recurrence of an AE if re-challenged, and currently requires maintenance doses of greater than 10 mg prednisone or equivalent per day?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in Cohort 1 (NSCLC/SCCHN/Bladder Cancer/cSCC cohort), did patient experience a greater than or equal to Grade 3 immune related AE or an immune related neurologic or ocular AE of any grade while receiving prior immunotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in Cohort 1 (NSCLC/SCCHN/Bladder Cancer/cSCC cohort) and has received prior anti-PD-1 or anti-PDL1 antibodies, did patient require the use of additional immunosuppression other than corticosteroids for the management of an AE, not have experienced recurrence of an AE if re-challenged, and currently requires maintenance doses of greater than 10 mg prednisone or equivalent per day?
